intro: Serialbizzia acle, commonly known as the golden flame shrub, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and vibrant yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has dark green, glossy leaves that provide a striking contrast to its colorful blossoms. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Serialbizzia acle is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant in tropical landscapes.
